unit_learning_outcomes.description: Describe main fields of contemporary medical and health-related research.
Critique and review medical and health-related research methods and/or data.
Evaluate scientific literature and relate to medical and health-related research data collected.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Ongoing readings that support research placement.
Online activities that support success in research placement.

enrolment_rules.description: (130cp at 1000 level or above) and permission by special approval

assessments.description: A poster presentation on the research activities undertaken during your placement and engagement in discussion with peers of of own and others research activities.
Creation of a graphical abstract of the work of a peer.
Engagement in your research placement, including documentation of research activities in a laboratory book or research diary and participation in research activities and discussion.
Research proposal based on the research placement.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde*
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde*
Session 2, Special circumstances*
Session 1, Special circumstances

* This unit offering is subject to a quota. Limited places are available. Please refer to the Faculty for further information.

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit will provide you with an insight into how research is conducted and research experience through a placement within a research team within the Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences . You will develop research skills and contribute to a research project under the supervision of a researcher within the Faculty. You will also develop your scientific communication skills allowing you to confidently discuss and present scientific methodology and findings. This unit is subject to a quota. Limited places are available. Please refer to the Faculty for further information.
data.title: Research Experience and Training
